meanings.definition: A minute opening in a plant leaf or stem through which gases and water vapor can pass.
meanings.sent1: The stomate on the leaf allows air to enter the plant.
meanings.sent2: Plants use stomates to breathe and release excess water vapor.
meanings.sent3: The stomate on the leaf was like a tiny door for the plant to get fresh air.
meanings.sent4: The stomate acted as a gateway, welcoming essential gases into the leaf.
meanings.sent5: I imagined the stomate as a tiny window through which the plant could peek outside.

meanings.definition: To have a stomate or stomates.
meanings.sent1: Plants stomate to regulate their internal environment.
meanings.sent2: During photosynthesis, plants stomate to exchange gases.
meanings.sent3: I stomated my plant experiment to see if it would grow better.
meanings.sent4: The plant stomates gracefully, adapting to its surroundings.
meanings.sent5: She carefully stomates her garden, ensuring each plant gets enough air.
